utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi guys!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey, Pheebs! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey. Oh, oh, how'd it go?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Um, not so good. He walked me to the subway and said 'We should do this again!'

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Ohh. Ouch.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? He said 'we should do it again', that's good, right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh, no. Loosely translated 'We should do this again' means 'You will never see me naked'.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Since always. It's like dating language. Y'know, like 'It's not you' means 'It is you'.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Or 'You're such a nice guy' means 'I'm gonna be dating leather-wearing alcoholics and complaining about them to you'.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Or, or, y'know, um, 'I think we should see other people' means 'Ha, ha, I already am'.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And everybody knows this?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. Cushions the blow.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, it's like when you're a kid, and your parents put your dog to sleep, and they tell you it went off to live on some farm.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's funny, that, no, because, uh, our parents actually did, uh, send our dog off to live on a farm.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh, Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? Wh- hello? The Millners' farm in Connecticut? The Millners, they had this unbelievable farm, they had horses, and, and rabbits that he could chase and it was- it w- .....Oh my God, Chi Chi!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: "So how does it feel knowing you're about to die?"

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: "Warden, in five minutes my pain will be over. But you'll have to live with the knowledge that you sent an honest man to die."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, that was really good!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks! Let's keep going.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. "So. Whaddya want from me, Damone, huh?"

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: "I just wanna go back to my cell. 'Cause in my cell, I can smoke."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: "Smoke away."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think this is probably why Damone smokes in his cell alone.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Relax your hand!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Not so much!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Alright, now try taking a puff.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Alright.. okay. No. Give it to me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No no no, I am not giving you a cigarette.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's fine, it's fine. Look, do you wanna get this part, or not? Here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don't think of it as a cigarette. Think of it as the thing that's been missing from your hand. When you're holding it, you feel right. You feel complete.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y'miss it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nah, not so much. Alright, now we smoke. Oh.. my.. God.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, no, no. They say it's the same as the distance from the tip of a guy's thumb to the tip of his index finger.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That's ridiculous!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Can I use.. either thumb?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Alright, don't tell me, don't tell me! Decaf cappucino for Joey.. Coffee black.. Late.. And an iced tea. I'm getting pretty good at this!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, excellent.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Good for me!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y'okay, Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah- no- I'm just- it's, I haven't worked- It's my bank.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What did they do to you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's nothing, it's just- Okay. I'm going through my mail, and I open up their monthly, you know, STATEMENT-

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Easy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: - and there's five hundred extra dollars in my account.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, Satan's minions at work again...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, 'cause now I have to go down there, and deal with them.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you talking about? Keep it!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's not mine, I didn't earn it, if I kept it, it would be like stealing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, but if you spent it, it would be like shopping!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, let's say I bought a really great pair of shoes. Do you know what I'd hear, with every step I took? 'Not-mine. Not-mine. Not-mine.' And even if I was happy, okay, and, and skipping- 'Not-not-mine, not-not-mine, not-not-mine, not-not-mine'...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We're with you. We got it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. I'd- just- I'd never be able to enjoy it. It would be like this giant karmic debt.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey. Whaddya doing?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh! Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What is this?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm smoking. I'm smoking, I'm smoking.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I can't believe you! You've been so good, for three years!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And this- is my reward!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hold on a second, alright? Just think about what you went through the last time you quit.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, so this time I won't quit!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Ohhh! Put it out!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right! I'm putting it out, I'm putting it out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, no! I- I can't drink this now!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright. I'm gonna go change, I've got a date.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This Alan again? How's it goin'?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: 'S'going pretty good, y'know? It's nice, and, we're having fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So when do we get to meet the guy?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Let's see, today's Monday... Never.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh, come on! Come on!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No. Not after what happened with Steve.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you talking about? We love Schhteve! Schhteve was schhexy!.. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look, I don't even know how I feel about him yet. Just give me a chance to figure that out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, then can we meet him?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nope. Schhorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I mean, why should I let them meet him? I mean, I bring a guy home, and within five minutes they're all over him. I mean, they're like- coyotes, picking off the weak members of the herd.

utterance.speaker: Paula
utterance.content: Listen. As someone who's seen more than her fair share of bad beef, I'll tell you: that is not such a terrible thing. I mean, they're your friends, they're just looking out after you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know. I just wish that once, I'd bring a guy home that they actually liked.

utterance.speaker: Paula
utterance.content: Well, you do realise the odds of that happening are a little slimmer if they never get to meet the guy..

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Let it go, Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you didn't know Chi Chi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you all promise?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah! We promise! We'll be good!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler? Do you promise to be good?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You can come in, but your filter-tipped little buddy has to stay outside!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 'Dear Ms. Buffay. Thank you for calling attention to our error. We have credited your account with five hundred dollars. We're sorry for the inconvenience, and hope you'll accept this- -football phone as our free gift.' Do you believe this?! Now I have a thousand dollars, and a football phone!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What bank is this?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey. It's him. Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: It's Alan.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler! He's here!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, please be good, please. Just remember how much you all like me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi. Alan, this is everybody. Everybody, this is Alan.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hi, Alan.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: I've heard schho much about all you guyschh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks. I'll call you tomorrow. Okay. Okay, let's let the Alan-bashing begin. Who's gonna take the first shot, hmm?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: C'mon!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...I'll go. Let's start with the way he kept picking at- no, I'm sorry, I can't do this, can't do this. We loved him.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Loved him! Yeah! He's great!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait a minute! We're talking about someone that I'm going out with?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And did you notice...?

utterance.speaker: The Guys
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Know what was great? The way his smile was kinda crooked.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, yes! Like the man in the shoe!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...What shoe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: From the nursery rhyme. 'There was a crooked man, Who had a crooked smile, Who lived in a shoe, For a... while...'

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...So I think Alan will become the yardstick against which all future boyfriends will be measured.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What future boyfriends? Nono, I th- I think this could be, y'know, it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. I'd marry him just for his David Hasselhof impression alone. You know I'm gonna be doing that at parties, right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know what I like most about him, though?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The way he makes me feel about myself.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.. how was the game?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well..

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: WE WON!! Thank you! Yes!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Fantastic! I have one question: How is that possible?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Alan.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He was unbelievable. He was like that-that-that Bugs Bunny cartoon where Bugs is playing all the positions, right, but instead of Bugs it was first base-Alan, second base-Alan, third base-...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean, it-it was like, it was like he made us into a team.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yep, we sure showed those Hassidic jewellers a thing or two about softball..

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Can I ask you guys a question? D'you ever think that Alan is maybe.. sometimes..

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ..I dunno, a little too Alan?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, no. That's impossible. You can never be too Alan.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, it's his, uh, innate Alan-ness that-that-that we adore.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I personally could have a gallon of Alan.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, Lizzie.

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: Hey, Weird Girl.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I brought you alphabet soup.

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: Did you pick out the vowels?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes. But I left in the Ys. 'Cause, y'know, "sometimes y". Uh, I also have something else for you.

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: Saltines?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, but would you like a thousand dollars and a football phone?

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: What? Oh my God, there's really money in here.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: Weird Girl, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I want you to have it. I don't want it.

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: No, no, I ha-I have to give you something.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, that's fine, no.

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: Would you like my tin-foil hat?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. 'Cause you need that. No, it's okay, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: Please, let me do something.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, alright, you buy me a soda, and then we're even. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: Keep the change. Sure you don't wanna pretzel?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Lizzie
utterance.content: See ya.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: A thumb?!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Eww!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know! I know, I opened it up and there it was, just floating in there, like this tiny little hitch-hiker!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, maybe it's a contest, y'know? Like, collect all five?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Does, um, anyone wanna see?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Nooo!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh, hey, don't do that! Cut it out!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It's worse than the thumb!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, this is so unfair!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, why is it unfair?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So I have a flaw! Big deal! Like Joey's constant knuckle-cracking isn't annoying? And Ross, with his over-pronouncing every single word? And Monica, with that snort when she laughs? I mean, what the hell is that thing? ...I accept all those flaws, why can't you accept me for this?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ...Does the knuckle-cracking bother everybody?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I-I could live without it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, is it, like, a little annoying, or is it like when Phoebe chews her hair?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, now, don't listen to him, Pheebs, I think it's endearing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, "you do, do you"?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know, there's nothing wrong with speaking correctly.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: "Indeed there isn't"... I should really get back to work.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, 'cause otherwise someone might get what they actually ordered.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh-ho-hooohhh. The hair comes out, and the gloves come on.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did you ever go out with a guy your friends all really like?

utterance.speaker: Paula
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.. Well, I'm going out with a guy my friends all really like.

utterance.speaker: Paula
utterance.content: Waitwait.. we talking about the coyotes here? All right, a cow got through!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Can you believe it? ...Y'know what? I just don't feel the thing. I mean, they feel the thing, I don't feel the thing.

utterance.speaker: Paula
utterance.content: Honey.. you should always feel the thing. Listen, if that's how you feel about the guy, Monica, dump him!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know.. it's gonna be really hard.

utterance.speaker: Paula
utterance.content: Well, he's a big boy, he'll get over it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, he'll be fine. It's the other five I'm worried about.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Do you have any respect for your body?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Don't you realise what you're-you're doing to yourself?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, y'know, I have had it with you guys and your cancer and your emphysema and your heart disease. The bottom line is, smoking is cool, and you know it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler? It's Alan, he wants to speak to you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really? He does? Hey, buddy, what's up! Oh, she told you about that, huh. Well, yeah, I have one now and then. Well, yeah, now. Well, it's not that big- ..well, that's true,.. Gee, y'know, no-one- no-one's ever put it like that before. Well, okay, thanks!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: God, he's good.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: If only he were a woman.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ooh, Lambchop. How old is that sock? If I had a sock on my hand for thirty years it'd be talking too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. I think it's time to change somebody's nicotine patch.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey. Where's Joey?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey ate my last stick of gum, so I killed him. Do you think that was wrong?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I think he's across the hall.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: There y'go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ooh, I'm alive with pleasure now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs, you gonna have the rest of that Pop-Tart?.. Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Does anyone want the rest of this Pop-Tart?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, I might!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sorry. ..Y'know, those stupid soda people gave me seven thousand dollars for the thumb.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: You're kidding. Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And on my way over here, I stepped in gum. ...What is up with the universe?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nothing. I just think it's nice when we're all here together.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Even nicer when everyone gets to wear their underwear..

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh, Joey..

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay..

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh! That was Lambchop!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Please, guys, we have to talk.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, wait, I'm getting a deja vu...no, I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright, we have to talk.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: There it is!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. It's-it's about Alan. There's something that you should know. I mean, there's really no easy way to say this.. uh.. I've decided to break up with Alan.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Is there somebody else?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, nononono.. it's just.. things change. People change.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We didn't change..

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So that's it? It's over? Just like that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You know.. you let your guard down, you start to really care about someone, and I just- I-

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look, I- I could go on pretending-

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: -but that wouldn't be fair to me, it wouldn't be fair to Alan- It wouldn't be fair to you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Who-who wants fair? Y'know, I just want things back. Y'know, the way they were.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sorry..

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, she's sorry! I feel better!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I just can't believe this! I mean, with the holidays coming up- I wanted him to meet my family-

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'll meet somone else. There'll be other Alans.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh, yeah! Right!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you guys gonna be okay?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey hey, we'll be fine. We're just gonna need a little time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I understand.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm, I'm really sorry.

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm sorry too. But, I gotta tell you, I am a little relieved.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Relieved?

utterance.speaker: Alan
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I had a great time with you.. I just can't stand your friends.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Remember when we went to Central Park and rented boats?.. That was fun.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. He could row like a viking.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So how'd it go?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, y'know..

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Did he mention us?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He said he's really gonna miss you guys.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You had a rough day, huh.. c'mere.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...That's it. I'm getting cigarettes.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: No no no!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't care, I don't care! Game's over! I'm weak! I've gotta smoke! I've gotta have the smoke!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: If you never smoke again I'll give you seven thousand dollars!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, alright.
